de.unisiegen.tpml.core.typechecker
Class TypeCheckerProofModel

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.util.beans.AbstractBean
      de.unisiegen.tpml.core.AbstractProofModel
          de.unisiegen.tpml.core.typechecker.TypeCheckerProofModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProofModel, Bean, TreeModel
public final class TypeCheckerProofModel
extends AbstractProofModel

The heart of the type checker. Type checker proof rules are supplied via an AbstractTypeCheckerProofRuleSet that is passed to the constructor.

Version:
$Rev: 486 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
AbstractProofModel, TypeCheckerProofContext, TypeCheckerProofNode

Constructor Detail

TypeCheckerProofModel

public TypeCheckerProofModel(Expression expression,
                             AbstractTypeCheckerProofRuleSet ruleSet)
Allocates a new TypeCheckerProofModel with the specified expression as its root node.

Parameters:
expression - the Expression for the root node.
ruleSet - the available type rules for the model.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if either expression or ruleSet is null.
See Also:
AbstractProofModel.AbstractProofModel(AbstractProofNode, AbstractProofRuleSet)
Method Detail

getIndex

public int getIndex()
Returns the current proof model index, which is the number of steps already performed on the model (starting with one) and used to allocate new, unique types.TypeVariables. It is incremented with every proof step performed on the model.

Returns:
the current index of the proof model.
See Also:
TypeCheckerProofContext.newTypeVariable(), types.TypeVariable

setIndex

void setIndex(int index)
Sets the current proof model index. This is a support operation, called by DefaultTypeCheckerProofContext whenever a new proof context is allocated.

Parameters:
index - the new index for the proof model.
See Also:
getIndex(), DefaultTypeCheckerProofContext, DefaultTypeCheckerProofContext.DefaultTypeCheckerProofContext(TypeCheckerProofModel)

guess

public void guess(ProofNode node)
           throws ProofGuessException
Guesses the next proof step for the specified node. The node must not be already proven (see the ProofNode.isProven() method for details), otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Specified by:
guess in interface ProofModel
Specified by:
guess in class AbstractProofModel
Parameters:
node - the ProofNode for which the next proof step should be guessed.
Throws:
ProofGuessException - if the next proof step could not be guessed.
See Also:
guessWithType(ProofNode, MonoType), AbstractProofModel.guess(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.ProofNode)

guessWithType

public void guessWithType(ProofNode node,
                          MonoType type)
                   throws ProofGuessException
Guesses the next proof step for the specified node using the type for the node. This method is used for the "Enter type" action in the type checker user interface. The node must not be already proven (see the ProofNode.isProven() method for details), otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Parameters:
node - the ProofNode for which the next proof step should be guessed.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the node is invalid for this model.
IllegalStateException - if for some reason node cannot be proven.
NullPointerException - if node or type is null.
ProofGuessException - if the next proof step could not be guessed.
See Also:
guess(ProofNode), prove(ProofRule, ProofNode)

prove

public void prove(ProofRule rule,
                  ProofNode node)
           throws ProofRuleException
Applies the given proof rule to the specified proof node. The node must not be already proven (see the ProofNode.isProven() method for details), otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Specified by:
prove in interface ProofModel
Specified by:
prove in class AbstractProofModel
Parameters:
rule - the ProofRule to apply.
node - the ProofNode to which the rule should be applied.
Throws:
ProofRuleException
See Also:
AbstractProofModel.prove(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.ProofRule, de.unisiegen.tpml.core.ProofNode)

contextAddProofNode

void contextAddProofNode(DefaultTypeCheckerProofContext context,
                         DefaultTypeCheckerProofNode node,
                         TypeEnvironment environment,
                         Expression expression,
                         MonoType type)
Adds a new child proof node below the node using the context, for the environment, expression and type.

Parameters:
context - the TypeCheckerProofContext on which the action is to be performed.
node - the parent DefaultTypeCheckerProofNode.
environment - the TypeEnvironment for the child node.
expression - the Expression for the child node.
type - the type variable or the concrete type for the child node, used for the unification.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if node is invalid for this tree.
NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.

contextApplySubstitution

void contextApplySubstitution(DefaultTypeCheckerProofContext context,
                              TypeSubstitution s)
Parameters:
s - the TypeSubstitution to apply to all nodes in the proof tree.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if s is null.

contextSetProofNodeRule

void contextSetProofNodeRule(DefaultTypeCheckerProofContext context,
                             DefaultTypeCheckerProofNode node,
                             TypeCheckerProofRule rule)
Used to implement the DefaultTypeCheckerProofContext#apply(TypeCheckerProofRule, TypeCheckerProofNode) method of the DefaultTypeCheckerProofContext class.

Parameters:
context - the type checker proof context.
node - the type checker node.
rule - the type checker rule.
See Also:
DefaultTypeCheckerProofContext#apply(TypeCheckerProofRule, TypeCheckerProofNode)
